_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The City of Alexandria Water Department Betty Street Site is located at 4931 Betty Street, Alexandria, LA  Chlorine used for chlorination of the City's drinking water supply is stored at this location.  A maximum of 4000 pounds of chlorine are stored in one ton cylinders.  In case of a chlorine leak, the City of Alexandria has an emergency response policy which requires City personnel to notify LA State Police HazMat by calling the 911 Center.  Local fire and police are notified.  These emergency personnel are used to assist in evacuating citizens in the affected area.

Currently, the City uses daily inspections and a comprehensive preventative maintenace program to ensure the system is operating properly.  There are no active or passive mitigation being used at the facility at the present time.

Plant personnel have been properly trained to handle chlorine stored in one ton cylinders.  Formal and on-the-job training ensures plant personnel have the necessary knowledge and skill to properly maintain the chlorination system.  The City of Alexandria has no history of reportable releases for chlorine at this site.  There have been no injuries or property loss associated with this chemical.

The City of Alexandria Betty Street Site is included in the written community emergency response plan.  The facility does not have its own written emergency response plan.  The facility notifies the 911 Center which contacts the State Police HazMat, local fire and police departments for assistance.  The City of Alexandria is reviewing possible active and passive mitigation in order to improve safety at the facility.  On-going operator training and preventative maintenance continue to be key tools to ensure the safety of the public.
